package.name: AirKeeper
package.shortDescription: Control wireless policy for apps and daemons

descriptionlist.description:
Control wireless policy for apps and daemons

This tweaks allows you to globally block/allow domains, or granulary control the wireless connectivity and policy for apps and daemons. It consists two mode: persistent; and non-persistent. Persistent works in both non-jailbroken and jailbroken mode, and non-peristent only works in jailbroken mode. All these are achieved with absolutely zero tweak hooking and make use of Apple's public NetworkExtension framework's private APIs, so I would assume it would be quite efficient. This tweak works on both iPhone and iPad (Wi-Fi/Cellular).

Features:
  • No tweak hooking

  • Block apps's wireless connectivity (WiFi and/or cellular)*

  • Globally block/allow domains

  • Granularly block/allow apps & daemons's wireless connectivity and traffic

  • Granularly set VPN profile per app and per traffic basis*

  • Works in non-jailbroken mode*

  • iPhone & iPad (Wi-Fi/Cellular)

  • Profiles (import/export)

  • CLI tool. "akp -h" for more details


*works in both jailbroken & non-jailbroken mode
This package tested to be working on iOS 14.3. Might or might not work on lower iOS version.
